skill.name: writing-utils
skill.description: Use this skill when you need to write utility functions for the Next.js app
skill.summary: Write modular, focused utility functions for Next.js applications
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged a false positive for weak cryptographic algorithms. The skill file SKILL.md contains only documentation text with no cryptographic code. The content_hash field uses SHA256 for integrity verification which is standard practice. No security concerns identified.

content.value_statement: Developers need clean, reusable utility functions to maintain code quality. This skill generates modular, focused utilities that follow best practices for Next.js applications.
actual_capabilities: Generate utility functions for Next.js applications
Create modular code with single-responsibility functions
Split complex utilities into focused helper modules
Enforce the 50-line limit per file for readability
limitations: Does not execute or test generated code
Does not integrate with existing project architecture
Does not validate generated functions against project-specific requirements
Does not provide type definitions for external libraries

use_cases.title: New Feature Development
use_cases.description: Quickly generate helper functions when building new features in a Next.js project

use_cases.title: Code Refactoring
use_cases.description: Break down complex functions into smaller, testable utilities

use_cases.title: Onboarding Support
use_cases.description: Help new team members understand utility patterns by generating reference implementations

prompt_templates.title: Basic Utility Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a utility function for the Next.js app that validates email addresses.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a simple validation helper

prompt_templates.title: Date Formatting Utility
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a utility function that formats dates in a human-readable format for the Next.js app.
prompt_templates.scenario: When working with date display in the UI

prompt_templates.title: Data Transformation Helper
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a utility function that transforms API responses into a consistent format for the Next.js app.
prompt_templates.scenario: When normalizing data from external sources

prompt_templates.title: Complex Utility Module
prompt_templates.prompt: Write multiple utility functions for the Next.js app that handle string manipulation: truncate, slugify, and capitalize. Split them into separate files.
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating a comprehensive string helper module

output_examples.input: Write a utility function that generates a random color hex code.
Write a utility to debounce function calls.
output: export function debounce<T extends (...args: unknown[]) => unknown>(

best_practices: Keep each utility focused on a single task for better testability and reuse
Use TypeScript types to make function inputs and outputs explicit
Extract related utilities into separate files to maintain the 50-line limit
anti_patterns: Creating utilities that handle multiple unrelated concerns in one function
Writing utility files that exceed 50 lines without splitting them
Hardcoding values instead of accepting them as function parameters

faq.question: What types of utilities can this skill generate?
faq.answer: This skill can generate various utility functions including validators, formatters, transformers, helpers for string manipulation, date handling, and more.

faq.question: Does this skill work with JavaScript projects?
faq.answer: The skill is optimized for TypeScript and Next.js, but can generate JavaScript utilities by removing type annotations.

faq.question: How does the 50-line limit work?
faq.answer: Each utility file should not exceed 50 lines. Complex utilities should be split into multiple focused files.

faq.question: Can I specify where to save the utility?
faq.answer: The skill generates the function code. You can specify the filename in your prompt and save it to the appropriate location in your project.

faq.question: Does this skill add the utility to my project automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill generates the code. You need to copy and save the utility to your project manually or through your editor.

faq.question: Can I request multiple utilities in one prompt?
faq.answer: Yes, you can request multiple related utilities. The skill will split them into separate files following the modular design rules.
